definition[0]: the way you think about something and your idea of what it is like
example[1]: the public perception of the government’s performance
definition[1]: the way that you notice things with your senses of sight, hearing etc
definition[2]: the natural ability to understand or notice things quickly
example[4]: Ross shows unusual perception for a boy of his age.
definition[3]: the way that people feel about a company, product, market etc and what they think it is like
example[5]: There is a perception among investors that an economic recovery is beginning.
example[6]: National stereotypes do play a role in product perceptions. For example, consumers will buy perfume because it is French.
example[7]: After he took over, he changed public perceptions (=what people thought) of the company.
